info.name: cv-library dark mode
info.description: cv-library.co.uk is a very very white website that was worsening a headache I had so I decided to give it a dark theme, enjoy! (The theme looks better in use than in the image, file size limit on this forcing severe jpg compression makes the images look a lot worse)
info.additionalInfo:
Credit to cv-library  for having a nice modern layout that was easy to work on. The fact that they used svg's for most images made theming this a lot easier to edit to suit this new darker look.

Bugs that I'm aware of: 
At the bottom of the job alerts page there's a few icons that in the wrong shade of blue (the old original colour that doesn't contrast nice with a dark theme, the first one is an envelope that has a white line through it rather than being transparent. Which looks fine on the original white site but looks a bit silly on a dark theme. Once I figure out how to that redo icon with proper transparency I'll update the theme.

There's probably more, but for a version 0.1 it seems to be pretty usable. As I'll be applying for more jobs I'll probably find new parts of the site that require theming but I'll try to keep this theme updated. I might try to reach out to cv-library as well once the theme is in good shape to see if they'd like to implement it right onto their site as a toggle.
